paragraph.keyLead: - 2 or more pprn; halter black; T5 completely silvery microtomentose...................................................................... 5

- Mesonotum brown microtomentose, scutellum same (Afrotropical, Oriental )
............................ M. triangula
sp. n.

10. 2 or more prs; wing white; silvery microtomentum long ...................................................
M. argentiventris Hendel

14. Mesonotum slightly brown microtomentose; ocellar triangle shiny (Australian)
............... M. weejasperensis
sp. n.

- Mesonotum brown microtomentose; ocellar triangle subshiny (Afrotropical)..........................
M. solitaria (Lamb)
17. Face not protruding; basitarsi completely black; tip of T5 silvery microtomentose or shiny black....................... 20
- Face protruding or not; mid and hind basitarsus yellowish; tip of T5 shiny black................................................. 18

18. Face protruding; labellum 1.0–1.4x as long as palpus and up to same length as vertical eye diameter; scutellum shiny black
............................................................................................................................... M. zaiziksensis
sp. n.

- Face protruding or not; labellum length variable; scutellum usually brown microtomentose, if shiny in middle then face not protruding .......................................................................................................................................... 19

19. Labellum and palpus elongate, labellum about 1.6x as long as palpus and slightly longer than vertical eye diameter; face protruding.....................................................................................................................
M. longirostris
sp. n.

- Labellum and palpus not elongate, labellum about as long as palpus; face not protruding
...... M. brevirostris
sp. n.
22. Tibiae completely black; posterior eye margin with narrow to medium notch (3–6om) ....................................... 24
- At least tip of fore and mid tibia yellow; posterior eye margin without or with narrow notch (2om) ................... 23

23. Posterior eye margin without notch but with emargination; silvery microtomentum on tergites extremely long and in rows
......................................................................................................................................... M. cochiseae
sp. n.

24. Calypter margin dark brown; T5 completely silvery microtomentose (Australian) ..................
M. nigripes Malloch
- Calypter margin hyaline or white; T5 silvery microtomentose except for black tip (Nearctic, Neotropical) ........ 25

25. Basitarsi black; silvery microtomentum on tergites long and in rows
......................................... M. faviformis
sp. n.

- Basitarsi yellow; silvery microtomentum on tergites short and not in rows
................................... M. virginae
sp. n.

27. Posterior orbital seta absent; T5 completely silvery microtomentose (Afrotropical) .........
M. argentiventris Hendel
- Small posterior orbital seta present; T5 silvery microtomentose except for brown tip (Nearctic, Neotropical).... 28

28. Pleuron silvery grey microtomentose on dorsal half; calypter margin yellow; halter yellow
.... M. villarricae
sp. n.
- Pleuron brown or slightly brown microtomentose; calypter margin dark brown; halter black ...................... M . sp. I

30. Basoflagellomere completely black; ground colour of male T2–4 black
........................................ M. mathisi
sp. n.

- Basoflagellomere basomedially yellow or red; ground colour of male T2–4 yellow
................ M. flaviventris
sp. n.

- Mesonotum slightly brown microtomentose, less microtomentose than scutellum
...................... M. ugandae
sp. n.
34. Mesonotum brown, slightly brown or brown microtomentose with grey anterior margin; halter black................ 43

- Mesonotum completely or partly silvery or grey microtomentose, but not brown microtomentose with grey anterior margin; halter yellow or black.......................................................................................................................... 35

40. Posterior orbital seta present; basoflagellomere completely black; palpus black........................
M. urbana Malloch

- Posterior orbital seta absent; basoflagellomere basomedially yellow or red; palpus yellow
M. cinerea (Coquillett)
41. Posterior orbital seta present; basoflagellomere completely black ................................................................ M . sp. P
- Posterior orbital seta absent; basoflagellomere basomedially yellow or red.......................................................... 42
- T5 anteriorly silvery microtomentose, posteriorly brown with tip sometimes shiny or subshiny.......................... 44
- At least tip of mid tibia yellow; seta between posterior dc and prsc usually absent, if present than only 2 dc...... 45

47. Basoflagellomere and arista relatively long pubescent; 3+1 dc
........................................................... M. rufa
sp. n.

- Basoflagellomere and arista normal pubescent; 2 dc .......................................................
M. dimidiata (Wiedemann)

51. Mesonotum with few setulae; pubescence on arista about as long as base of arista wide
................. M. rutila
sp. n.
- Mesonotum with normal setulae; pubescence on arista shorter than base of arista wide ..........M. sp. M & M . sp. N

- Tip of fore and mid tibia, and all basitarsi yellow ..............................................................
M. unicolor (de Meijere)

55. Posterior orbital seta absent; frontal setae proclinate; frons narrowest in middle ......................
M. proclinata
sp. n.
- Posterior orbital seta present; frontal setae medioclinate; frons narrowest anteriorly............................................ 56
- Posterior orbital seta present or absent; mesonotum completely brown microtomentose...................................... 58

59. Frontal plates greyish microtomentose; posterolateral corners of S5 developed into shiny lappets with long setae. ......................................................................................................................................................
M. aldabrae
sp. n.

- Frontal plates brown microtomentose; S5 without shiny lappets
................................................. M. formosae
sp. n.
62. Posterior eye margin without notch but sometimes with narrow emargination ..................................................... 68
63. Fore basitarsus black; mesonotum shiny to fully microtomentose......................................................................... 66
- Fore basitarsus yellow; mesonotum slightly or fully microtomentose, not shiny .................................................. 64

65. Mesonotum brown microtomentose with grey anterior margin ..........................................
M. novateutoniae
sp. n.

- Mesonotum brown or slightly brown microtomentose ......................................................................
M. tristis Lamb

67. Ocellar triangle shiny; mesonotum shiny black .....................................................................
M. lacteipennis (Loew)

- Ocellar triangle brown microtomentose; mesonotum brown microtomentose
............................ M. aeroplana
sp. n.
68. Lower (middle) frontal seta medioclinate; posterior eye margin with narrow emargination on ventral half........ 71

69. 3 dc; mesonotum slightly brown microtomentose
...................................................................... M. pachycerei
sp. n.

70. Basoflagellomere basomedially yellowish; palpus and basitarsi yellowish
......................... M. santacatalinae
sp. n.

- Basoflagellomere completely black; palpus and basitarsi black
................................................... M. mexicana
sp. n.
71. Mesonotum grey and brown microtomentose; T5 grey or brown microtomentose................................................ 72

- Mesonotum subshiny black; T5 subshiny anteriorly, shiny black posteriorly ................................
M. hendeli Brake
72. Mesonotum grey microtomentose with more or less visible and extended brown stripes ...........................M . sp. L

- Mesonotum anterior margin grey, posteriorly brown microtomentose
.................................... M. flavilunulae
sp. n.

76. T5 silvery grey microtomentose except for brown anterior margin
...................................... M. quintargentea
sp. n.

keyLead.keyStep:
77. S5 more densely setulose and setulae longer (Pl. 2H); shape of surstylus as in Pl. 1B
................. M. opuntiae
sp. n.

paragraph.keyLead:
- S5 less setulose and setulae shorter (Pl. 2G); shape of surstylus as in Pl. 2A
...................... M. pseudopuntiae
sp. n.

79. Basoflagellomere black; scutellum slightly brown microtomentose......................................
M. aethiops (Malloch)

- Basoflagellomere basomedially yellow; scutellum brown microtomentose
................................... M. peyotei
sp. n.
81. T5 brown microtomentose with paired posterolateral silvery or grey spots .......................................................... 84

82. Ocellar triangle brown microtomentose; T3–5 completely silvery microtomentose
......................... M. mollis
sp. n.

83. Anterior margin of wing slightly brownish; tip of T5 brown microtomentose
............................ M. christmas
sp. n.

85. Posterior orbital seta present; wing hyaline (Nearctic)
................................................................ M. chocolata
sp. n.
- Posterior orbital seta absent; wing partly or completely brownish or brown (Australian)..................................... 86
87. Ocellar triangle brown microtomentose; frons not strikingly silvery or grey from anterior view ....................... 100

- Ocellar triangle shiny or subshiny black; if slightly microtomentose than frons black from posterior view but strikingly silvery or grey from anterior view .......................................................................................................... 88
89. Posterior prescutellar seta less than 0.8x as long as posterior dorsocentral seta .................................................... 93
- Posterior prescutellar seta about as long as posterior dorsocentral seta ................................................................. 90
- Posterior eye margin with notch and emargination parallel to head margin; frons brown or subshiny black........ 91

91. T5 silvery microtomentose except for brown anterior margin
.............................................. M. quintargentea
sp. n.

92. Mesonotum slightly brown microtomentose; 1 prsc; 1 pprn ................................................
M. iberica Carles-Tolrá

93. Mesonotum brown microtomentose except for grey anterior margin
........................................ M. argentinae
sp. n.

94. Frons black from posterior view but strikingly silvery or grey from anterior view
............ M. abditoargentea
sp. n.

96. T5 brown microtomentose except for posterolateral silvery spots .........................................
M. bimaculata Becker

97. T5 silvery microtomentose with brown microtomentose tip ..................................................
M. sterkstrooma
sp. n.

98. Mesonotum shiny black with metallic blue green sheen
.............................................................. M. metallica
sp. n.
- Mesonotum shiny or subshiny black without metallic blue green sheen ............................................................... 99
100. Mesonotum brown microtomentose with grey or greyish anterior margin or half............................................... 104

102. Posterior orbital seta present; calypter margin brown
............................................................... M. fusciventris
sp. n.

- Posterior orbital seta absent; calypter margin hyaline
...................................................... M. madagascarensis
sp. n.

keyLead.keyStep:
103. 2+1 dc; T5 brown microtomentose with paired silvery microtomentose posterolateral spots .....
M. velutina Becker
- 2 dc; T5 anteriorly silvery microtomentose, middle brown microtomentose and tip shiny or subshiny.................... ...................................................................................................................................................
M. cingulata Becker

paragraph.keyLead:
104. T5 brown microtomentose with paired grey microtomentose posterolateral spots
....................... M. acantha
sp. n.
108. T5 anteriorly silvery microtomentose, middle black, tip bluish or silvery white ................................................. 111
- T5 completely silvery microtomentose or with (sub)shiny black tip ................................................................... 109

109. Posterior orbital seta present; 1 prs; calypter margin light brown .................................................
M. chilensis
sp. n.
- Posterior orbital seta absent; 2 or more prs; calypter margin dark brown ............................................................ 110

- T3–4 anteriorly silvery, posteriorly brown microtomentose
........................................................ M. cooloolae
sp. n.

111. T3–4 anteriorly silvery, posteriorly brown microtomentose .....................................................
M. frontalis (Becker)

- T2 brown microtomentose except for silvery posterior margin and lateral sides ....................
M. montana (Becker)

114. Mesonotum brown microtomentose with grey posteromedial spot .......................................
M. griseomacula
sp. n.
116. Halter black; T3–4 anteriorly silvery, posteriorly brown microtomentose........................................................... 125
- Halter black or yellow; T3–4 colour pattern different, if same then halter yellow .............................................. 117
117. Halter yellow; T2 brown microtomentose with silvery posterolateral corner ...................................................... 124

119. T3–4 silvery microtomentose except for row of black dots at posterior margin ..............
M. poecilogastra (Becker)

121. Frons dull brown or black; 2 or more prs; T3–4 completely silvery microtomentose ........................
M. tiefii (Mik)

- Frons shiny; 1 prs; T3–4 shiny black except for silvery microtomentose anterior margin
......... M. boliviana
sp. n.

123. 2+1 dc; mesonotum slightly brown microtomentose (Australian) ......................................
M. lacteiventris Malloch

124. Mesonotum shiny black except for anterior and posterior margin, scutellum and pleuron slightly brown microtomentose ....................................................................................................................................
M. lucidula Becker

- Mesonotum brown microtomentose (sometimes only slightly), scutellum same, pleuron slightly grey white microtomentose .........................................................................................................................
M. argenteocincta Johnson
- Mesonotum grey microtomentose with dark spots at bases of setae or with brown longitudinal stripes............. 131

131. Face silvery grey microtomentose; 3 prsc; anterior margin of the wing brown
.................................. M. bella
sp. n.

- Posterior eye margin without notch but with emargination (2–3om); T2–4 brown microtomentose except for grey sides, T5 grey microtomentose ......................................................................................................................M. sp. L
